meanings.definition: To thrust forward or impose oneself unasked or unwelcomed
meanings.sent1: The loud music obtrudes into my peaceful study time.
meanings.sent2: The bright neon sign obtrudes on the serene landscape.
meanings.sent3: The nosy neighbor always obtrudes into everyone's business.
meanings.sent4: His overbearing presence obtrudes like a giant shadow over the room.
meanings.sent5: The pungent smell of the garbage obtrudes into the entire building.

meanings.definition: To become noticeable in an unwelcome or intrusive way
meanings.sent1: The smell of burnt popcorn obtrudes from the microwave.
meanings.sent2: The loud laughter obtrudes from the otherwise quiet library.
meanings.sent3: The bright red hat obtrudes in the sea of black and white outfits.
meanings.sent4: Her piercing gaze obtrudes into the depths of your soul.
meanings.sent5: The sudden sound of thunder obtrudes on the peaceful night.
